organization_description_6: The Department of Statistics of the University of Colombo is the only statistics department in a faculty of science in a Sri Lankan University. It has a rich history of teaching, research, and consulting, spanning over several decades. The department is a small cohesive unit with a supportive atmosphere.  I involved in: •	Data Science - The first part of the Data Science course, Python for Data Science, which was designed for the final year undergraduates of Statistics & Industrial Statistics special degrees and Applied Statistics Theme at Department of Statistics was done by me. Under this lecture the fundamentals of Python, numpy array operations, pandas operations as well as the visualization with matplotlib were discussed. And also some motivation for Python functions and the Object Oriented Programming in Python was given briefly.   •	Applied Statistical Models - The R programming basic course was done by me under this ST 3008 course which was designed for 3rd year Applied Statistics Theme undergraduates . Here the basics of R, working with data frames and manipulation, visualization options as well as the random sample generation and related topics were focused.   •	Essentials proofs of the Regression Analysis were discussed with the 3rd year undergraduates from different streams; Industrial Statistics Special, Mathematics Special, Insurance & Finance Theme, Management Science Theme and General.   •	Working as an instructor for MINI TAB for first year undergraduates.   •	Working as an instructor for SPSS for second year undergraduates.

Zepto has always been obsessed about how we could make people understand data better. Since its launch in 2017, Zepto has helped its users understand their business data better and its full potential.  Currently I'm involving : •	Developing a machine learning platform for data sense of the ZEPTO system - AI & Machine Learning •	Modifying the existing quick insight generation of ZEPTO system - Data Science.  •	Automated sample generating algorithm & implementation in Python. •	Automated intelligent algorithm to String ID identification. •	Applying automated Odds Ratio generation and generating insights. •	Simulating data to test the uploading performance of the new system. •	Quality assurance for file merging functionality of the new system. •	Developing a method for reducing the complexity of Scatter Plots.Under this researching on High Density Sampling, Splatter Plots and Adding Jitter Methods using MATPLOTLIB and SEABORN.  •	Researching on top 10 related BI products in the international market and checking the possibility of adding new insight types to the system . •	AI algorithm and Python implementation of waterfall charts  for the ZEPTO system as the newest quick insight.

headline: Junior Data Scientist - Innovation Quotient (Pvt)Ltd
organization_description_1: I was a member of the Data Science Team at Innovation Quotient (IQ).  IQ is a company which combines Digital Marketing, Technology and Creative Design to provide user-centered innovative solutions to companies and brands across Sri Lanka, and globally.  I have worked on the following projects to date:     •  EFL Invoice Automation - Implemented a system that extracts information from invoices using computer vision and optical character recognition and upon approval, creates a job in ERP system with the relevant extracted information. Technologies used: Google Cloud Vision, Python, Anaconda and Azure Web Services.      • EFL Chatbot - Development of a virtual assistant for EFL Global webpage designed to provide customers support services with a backend in-built analytics platform. Technologies used: JavaScript, Rasa, Python,  Anaconda, and Spyder.      • IQ Data Lake – Research and development of data pipelines for secure storage of raw and processed IQ data. This data needs to be easily accessible for tasks such as reporting, visualization, analytics and machine learning.      • Credit Card Positioning - Value proposition and positioning space for introducing new credit card of one of the leading banks in the banking sector. Technologies used: Python (Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, bokeh), Anaconda, and Spyder.      • Rebranding of a Virtual Payment Platform – Analysed current purchase behaviour of the payment app, evaluated it against existing data from IQ data Lake. Provided actionable insights to increase merchant base and improve app services. Python (Matplotlib), Anaconda, and Spyder.            • Tourism Insights – Scrapped and analysed travel questions from various travel websites and travel forums, to find actionable insights to segment and improve the tourism industry in Sri Lanka. Technologies used:  Python (NLTK, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Selenium, Beautiful Soup), Anaconda, and Spyder Twitter-Search API, Google Translate API.

headline: Data Scientist at ANZ
organization_description_1: Roles at ANZ Institutional Banking Group.  Retail Analytics and Transaction banking are part of Institutional Analytics Platform, which has insights and intelligent signals for customers, collected from multiple data sources.  •	Analyzing huge amount of Retail data, approx. 2 Billion records, for Demographic, competitor and Loyalty analysis •	Analyzing transactions, balances, billing, customer relationships and SLA data to create insights •	Development in JavaScript, React, PostgreSQL, Google Big Query, git, .NET APIs, and microservices to create Analytical product •	Creating data pipelines using Python Apache Airflow and C# .NET Core pipelines •	Creating end to end development in Google Cloud infrastructure using Kubernetes, Terraform and Gitlab CI/CD pipelines •	Creating minimum viable product using a lean methodology to get initial customer feedback •	Using Stack Driver, Splunk and Grafana for logging and monitoring SLI/SLO dashboards •	Development of new features and unit testing using Jest and React Testing Library •	Working in Agile Scrumban sprint methodology with experience of iteration manager
organization_description_2: Order Inventory Data Warehouse | Feb 2016 – Jan 2017 Business Intelligence Support for SKF  Order Inventory Data warehouse is an enterprise warehouse and data mart which manages the orders and inventory globally. This includes getting the transactions from DOH (Dispatch Order Handling) System, moving to iSeries AS400 DB2, SQL server for staging & data warehouse, to Sybase IQ Data marts. IBM Cognos to create data mart reports and Cube operations for end users. •	Handling of incidents from SKF users using HPSM tool for L2 and L3 technical support •	Monitoring of Daily loads and total loads for errors or delays •	Look for data consistency and if exist then propose resolution for the same •	Development of new changes and tasks related to Improvement  •	Working in collaboration with Other teams which includes DOH, ICSS, iSeries, SQL BDAs, Informatica Admin, Cognos and Sybase   Inventory Accounting 2 | March 2016 – Jan 2017 Informatica Application Owner, Business Intelligence Support for SKF  IA2 deals with - in and out flow of inventory data. It generates the Cognos report to show the Inventory count and data in SKF physical warehouse. IA2 has daily loads, reloads and Monthly loads which gets the data from multiple sources. The daily loads get data on daily basis, which is used to run the monthly reports. •	Single point of contact from BI Team •	Handling the loading of files in Monthly Load •	Check for IA2 related queries and Incidents •	Active involvement in all IA2 meeting, and development tasks   Project – LISA | March 2016 – Jan 2017 Application Owner, Business Intelligence Support for SKF  LISA System handles the service structure, price list, customer master and currencies. LISA administrator verifies and loads local charge files into Oracle Database and LISA master Application. Trigger is initiated from Informatica end to refresh Cognos Cubes •	Handling the loading of files •	Single point of contact from BI Team •	Check for All LISA related queries and Incidents
organization_description_3: Project – Fleet Phoenix Driver Automation Transformation | Jun 2015 – Nov 2015 Senior Software Engineer, ETL Development for GE Capital  UK Fleet business has various contract from Customers. It is updated in Phoenix Ingress database on daily and weekly basis. This process is automated using Informatica Power Center. •	Project Management - Working as Single point of contact with client GE Capital. Responsible for organizing daily and weekly calls with maintenance of project tracker.  •	Designing - Dealing with analysis of source and target systems, Designing the high-level design, architecture, logic and database model. •	Development – Responsible for creation of Mapping, transformation, workflows and Shell Scripts. Ensuring compliance of Informatica Standards and IDQ rules. •	Testing – Dealing with creation the test case, migrating the code from DEV to UAT and operating end to end testing for UAT.   Oracle R12 Consumer Migration - Global Banking Phase III | Sep 2014 – May 2015 Oracle R12 Consumer Migration - Global Banking Phase II | Dec 2013 – Aug 2014 Senior Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Developer for GE Capital  GE Capital EMEA biz has various banks and financial services. It loads daily/monthly transactions to General Ledger Data warehouse in Oracle 12 Database using Informatica & Oracle Apps. •	Responsible for Creating Workflows, Mappings, Mapplets, sources, targets and transformations for Interfaces. •	Delivering the design documents and follow up with clients for approval. •	Providing the best and suitable solution as per the Business Requirement considering existing architecture. •	Managing validation, reconciliation of data, Tracking, Monitoring, Performance Tuning, Optimization and Usage of Standardized Best Practices for Interfaces. •	Responsible for creating shell scripts based on requirements, scheduling the workflows, handling the Database lookup.
organization_description_4: Founder | Jun 2012 – May 2013  Ehubz provides information regarding various E-Commerce websites in India. headline: Machine Learning Engineer at Ericsson
organization_description_2: Part of the Custom apps and New technologies group at Merck IT centre (MITC).  •	Working for a Healthcare sales & marketing project where objective is to provide actionable insights (suggestions) to sales reps using data. •	Data transformation is made using a suggestion generation pipeline which uses different AWS services. •	Worked on converting Business use cases to insights using prestosql and python. •	Built a ML classification model (Decision tree algorithm) based on sales rep feedback data to predict acceptence of suggestions. •	The model deployment provided more relevant, reliable suggestions increasing sales rep's engagement rate by 20%. •	Worked on building a anomaly detection system to flag irrelevant suggestions before they are published. •	Co-ordinated with team on deployment of suggestions in different AWS environments. •	Reduced use case implementation time by over 60% using dynamic plugin classes involving data manipulation. •	Parallelly worked on a project for IoT application team, analyzed and presented findings on IoT log data. The analysis helped in adding new features for the application.
organization_description_3: •	Research based on network log management using technologies such as Machine Learning which included Clustering, NLP, Topic Modelling. •	Analyzed existing log parsing techniques such as Iterative partitioning log mining (IPLoM), Log key extraction (LKE), Message template extractor (MTE), LogSig, Simple logfile clustering (SLCT), LogCluster. •	Experimented on frameworks such as ELK Stack, Splunk to perform Log Analysis. •	Developed POC on a Tree based clustering technique to overcome drawbacks of existing Log parsing techniques. •	Presented Master’s thesis with a full score of 10 GPA for the outstanding work during the internship which later led to a conference paper presentation.
organization_description_4: •	Extensive training on Mainframe development as part of fresher on-boarding. •	Worked on maintaining Mainframe test environment and handled critical level tasks with respect to the test environment for a large insurance company (client). •	Analyzed HPSM based tickets historical data out of self-interest, which eventually led me to pursue data science.

headline: Data Scientist | Computer Vision & NLP
organization_description_1: ● Spine Area and Diameter prediction: Goal- To calculate the area and diameter of the thecal sac in a spine MRI scan.     ○ Planned the project end-to-end. Converted the business problem to a data science problem and designed the solution. Coordinated with domain experts.     ○ Result- Project still in development phase.  ● Covid Severity Prediction: Goal- To predict the severity of Covid Infection on a scale of 0-25 from a CT Scan.     ○ Implemented an innovative model architecture from a research paper. Trained a segmentation model & combined it with a Linear Model.     ○ Result- Reduced time spent per scan for radiologists by 50%.  ● Abnormality Detection: Goal- Detect Abnormality in Chest X-Rays to aid radiologists in screening.     ○ Implemented a custom Unet++ architecture. Used Contour Detection to convert masks to bounding boxes.     ○ Result- Helped screen 50K+ X-Rays during Covid 2nd wave in India.  * Worked on deployment pipelines of AI service for CT scans. * Worked on cleaning, preprocessing, anonymization, and storing (in MongoDB) of data and annotations of 1500+ GB.
organization_description_2: Effects of Haze and Dehazing: Goal- To study the effects of haze and synthetic dehazing on vision models. ○ Implemented training and testing pipelines to study the effects of 3 levels of haze on 3 different detection models and analyzed results. ○ Result- Dehazing improves mAP by up to 10%. Paper under revision.
organization_description_3: PPE Kit Detection: Goal- Verify that the staffs are wearing the PPE kit. ○ Applied Noisy Student Semi-Supervised learning approach to train a YOLOv5x model. ○ Result- Detects presence and absence of PPE Kit with an mAP of 90+%. Deployed as an API.  * Modularize and optimized the code for existing deployment pipelines. * Optimized models for inference using Intel OpenVINO, increasing the throughput by upto 50%. * Deployed models using OpenVINO Serving, Tensorflow Serving, gRPC/REST API, Flask and Docker.

headline: Chief ML Engineer | CEO @ Data Atelier

organization_title_2: Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer
organization_description_2: Projects  1 - BUILT VARIOUS CHATBOTS FOR ONE OF THE LARGEST TRANSPORT COMPANIES  Worked as an NLP expert to provide the best possible Machine Learning solutions for Bots to understand and process natural language. The Chatbots can handle lost & found requests as well as frequently asked questions - completely replacing live agents.  Tools/Techniques Used: Tensorflow, Google Dialogflow, Google Cloud Functions, Google Compute Engine, Docker and Fulfillment.  2 - CORPORATE TRAINER FOR INDUSTRY PROJECTS ON ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE  I have worked as a corporate trainer at ADDO to share my skills and expertise regarding various Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) projects. I have helped in the creation of various industry geared courses for the trainings to make sure that the Industry and Academia gap can be bridged effectively.  3 - CONSULTANCY ON A LARGE BIG DATA ANALYTICS PLATFORM  Provided consultancy services to a large healthcare organization regarding shortcomings in their current data analytics platform and their solution through a future state of Data Architecture with a comprehensive migration strategy. We chose Microsoft Azure for a hybrid Cloud deployment strategy. We received very positive reviews from Gartner regarding our work.  4 - BUILT ETL/ELT PIPELINES FOR BIG DATA JOBS AND ORCHESTRATED THESE IN PRODUCTION  Worked as a Data Engineer to create, test and deploy ETL pipelines on Hive, Teradata and Vertica.  Tools/Techniques Used:​ ​Pyspark, Bash Scripting, Git, SQL, Vertica and SLJM.  5 - DEVELOPED SPEECH RECOGNITION SYSTEM IN MANDARIN FOR A CALL CENTER  Worked as a Senior Data Scientist to research and develop a state of art Mandarin ASR system. The ASR was built using wav2vec2 from Facebook. The results were great and we achieved a WER of ~25 after the final language model.  Tools/Techniques Used:​ Tensorflow, Python, Wave2Vec2 Model, AWS

headline: Data and Applied Scientist II at Microsoft
summary: Data Scientist with a demonstrated history of working in different machine learning problems and employing applied ML solutions for solving business problems. I have led and productionized various modelling components involved in online ad recommendation system for Bing Search Engine. This roughly includes executing and designing end-to-end pipelines, applied machine learning research, user and audience targeting, feature engineering, model optimization, large scale ML, computer vision. I have Integrated B.Tech.-M.Tech. Dual degree focused in Computer Science and Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur. Published in ACCV.
organization_description_1: Microsoft advertising (Bing Ads): CTR predition of ads for ranking in recommendation system, bounce back rate prediction (used in ad ranking and bidding strategy), Audience targeting for 300+ user segments, Seasonality and editorial exploration of ads to meet market demands etc.
organization_description_2: TA for Course: Computer Vision and Image Processing.
organization_description_3: Enrolled as B.T.-M.T. Dual degree student, I completed my Masters in the field of Computer Vision and Machine Learning. My thesis is entitled - Using Gaussian Processes to Improve Zero-Shot Learning with Relative Attributes.   Supervisor: Dr. Vinay P. Namboodiri   Zero-shot learning is a challenging problem and relative attributes can serve as a very useful method for zero-shot learning of images where an image is expressed in terms of attributes that are relatively specified between different class pairs. The work  contributed to a principled approach that uses Gaussian Process based classification to obtain the posterior probability for each sample of an unknown target class, in terms of GP classification and regression. Different variants of this approach were analysed and showed that the approach yields improved performance and a better understanding in terms of probabilistic estimates. The method is evaluated on standard Pubfig and Shoes with Attributes benchmarks.  Accepted in ACCV'2016 and included in the proceedings of Springer, March 2017.
organization_description_4: The B.Tech program is a four year program which introduced me to Computer Science, its theoretical and practical aspects and the vast possibilities that one can choose to deep dive into and enjoy. The program facilitated core curriculum, which accounts for common course in Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Technical Arts and Engineeering Sciences, and professional curriculum which facilitated "open-electives" and departmental-electives. I majored in Computer Science and Engineering, with my interests growing in the world of Computer Vision and Machine Learning. I further completed my Masters' in CVML. For more details about the courses and the projects done, please see the lists given in the profile below.  Apart from CS major, I was exposed to a number of courses in the field of Humanities and Social sciences.  I minored in English Literature.

Recieved a Pre-Placement Offer from Amazon.com, Inc.

summary: I am someone who transitioned his career from Manual Tester to Data Scientist without paying Lakhs of rupees to big institutes. I help people do the same:)  Currently I am working on Recommendation Engine Development in Tredence Analytics. I am a member of core Data Scientist Team known as AI CoE(Center of Excellence).  In past I have worked on Regression, Classification and Clustering for an Industrial IoT Data Science Project. There I was able to increase the efficiency of the Power Plant by 7.1%  Most recently, I developed Recommendation Engine for an App named BigHaat(Play Store)  Given that I struggled a lot to get DS jobs and after giving 40+ interviews and having 8+ offers, I thought of making a course to help people upskill themselves  without much investment of money.  The course is called "AI for All". The most affordable, high quality content, assignments and mentorship course. Do check it out at: www.cloudyml/ai4all  Also don't forget to check my YouTube channel: www.youtube.com/c/cloudyML
organization_description_2: 1. Optimizing the NOx emission & Cost of Thermal Power Plant:  -Cleaned and merged the IoT sensors(3000) data of a Thermal Power Plant -Developed Framework for extracting Steady State data from raw(noisy) Sensor Data -Performed EDA and Descriptive Statistics on the raw data as well as steady data -Performed Feature Engineering to generate many useful features -Developed Model building framework for trying various Models like Linear Regression, Rigde, Lasso, KNNRegressor, RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor, XgboostRegressor -Built 80 predictive models for predicting various parameters of using IoT sensor data of the Power Plant. Best model was selected based on Adjusted R-squared and RMSE -Built Optimization framework using PSO(Particle Swarm Optimization)  2. Coal Properties Prediction from IOT Sensors of a Thermal Power Plant:  -Predicting Coal properties based on Data from IOT Sensors of a Japanese Thermal Power Plant -Optimized the Steady State Extraction, Feature Selection frameworks -Built 6 predictive models with Sensor data as Input Features and Lab Data of Coal properties as output -Coal Analysis- Developed Algorithm for Coal clustering(as KMeans didn't give desired results) -Develop Coal change detection Algorithm -Coal Properties includes: Ash Softening Point, VM, Moisture, Ash, CV and FC  3. Deploy Machine Learning Architecture on AWS SageMaker:  -Deploy the full machine learning architecture on AWS Sagemaker for model building, retraining, optimization and deployment -Dockerized the Steady State Extraction Framework, Modelling building Framework, Feature Selection Framework, Optimization Framework and Deploy in ECR(Elastic Container Registry) -Create Lambda(serverless) functions to invoke these algorithms from SageMaker

headline: Data Analyst| Data scientist
summary: It has been my desire to join an organization with challenging prospects in the fields of statistics, data analysis, data engineer, data scientist and to contribute towards the growth of such an establishment in a logically and meaningful manner. I am mature, positive and hardworking individual, who always strives to achieve the highest standard possible, at any given task.
organization_description_3: Project: Fitting the suitable model for Inflation forecasting. Analysis was carried out to find the suitable models for forecasting inflation. Read about the research papers about methods which are used in other Asian countries. • Using Machine learning technique - LSTM model. Divide the data into train and test set and univariate model is built up with twelve lag terms, three neurons. Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) is calculated to verify the accuracy of the model. Difference range of data set is tested to find out the accuracy and compared with the current trend. Python is used to build the model. • SARIMA model with time series regression As an initial stage, data set is divided into train and test set. By using the ACF and PACF plot, Parameters of SARIMA model (p, q, P and Q) are identified. By using the suitable nine explanatory variables, significant variables are choosing by using random forest and models is built up with three explanatory variables. MAPE is used to calculate the model accuracy by using the test set. R is used to build the model.

organization_description_4: The goal of this project is to classify time series data, based on its chaotic nature or absence there of. To solve these kinds of problems scientists have been employing classical non linear dynamics techniques for decades. In this project we explored an single-layer feed-forward Artificial Neural Network to classify the time series data based on the network's sensitivity. In future, I would like to further work on this project to obtain the quantitative measure of it's chaoticity.

headline: Data Scientist
summary: I am a PhD in the domain of machine learning and intelligent systems with around 12 years of experience in multiple domains. Precisely, having 10 years of experience in experimental design, applied machine learning, data science and statistical analysis; and 2 years of experience in designing and simulating routing protocols for wireless networks.
organization_description_1: * Worked on automating incident resolution systems in telecom networks. The problem was to understand the incoming incidents in terms of how they affect the network and then to recommend resolutions for the same. Incidents are composed of one or more events. We extract key features about the existing incidents and apply clustering to identify similar incidents. Then we extract distribution of key features in those clusters for each event. For a new incoming incident, we apply probability techniques to identify, to which cluster it belongs to, and provide resolution for the same. * Worked on Duplicate Defects detection project to identify duplicate defects logged by the testers. We encode the defects into word vectors using pre-trained embeddings and then compare the similarity between two defects. Our system was able to classify around 90% of the data correctly.
organization_title_2: Chief Engineer,  Samsung R&D Institute India - Bengaluru
organization_description_2: * Worked in a team for creating digital profiles of users in terms of how they use their digital appliances. I worked on ensuring data quality by analyzing the data using Spark, R and Python and communicating those issues to the relevant teams. I was also involved at various design stages, where decisions have to be made regarding pattern mining for IoT data. * Was a part of the team that was developing smart appliances. I was responsible for designing a structured data format from raw event data to achieve the desired objective. I was also responsible for cleaning the data using R and designing a method for assessing the performance of prediction models. * Developed B2B use cases for IoT related applications and prepared a draft about the data, process and concerning issues to solve them. * Defined research problems and wrote proposals for university collaborations. * Managed interns where my role was to define problems and ensure that the results achieved are satisfactory. * Was a reviewer for multiple Samsung internal conferences.
organization_title_3: Data Specialist, IBM Global Business Services
organization_description_3: * Worked as a part of the Natural Language Processing (NLP) team on a "support, maintenance and enhancement" project for a major banking client. The goal of this project was to provide IT solution to the hardware, software and other product issues faced by the client through interactive chat application. I have worked on addressing the NLP issues, in the tool; and enhancing its capabilities using Python * Worked on a dirty implementation of a machine learning algorithm for classifying an incoming "User Problem Statement" to an appropriate workflow using Python. * Built models using SPSS and Python to forecast crack spreads and price spreads (margin of profit) for multiple oil and natural gas by-products across different global regions for a major global oil and natural gas company.
organization_description_4: * Performed text mining using R on the social network data to gain insights such as the key operational issues related to a product and understanding the sentiment of customers across different regions. * Performed analysis on the raw data from a utility sector using Apache Spark, R and Hive, to identify patterns that help in customer segmentation; load forecasting over different geographical regions.
organization_description_5: * Explored state-of-the-art machine learning techniques using Weka to realize intelligent lighting system that provides suitable lighting conditions to its users based on the observed context. * Inferred an interesting one-to-many non-deterministic relationship between input and output. * Devised a new performance metric dubbed "Relevance Score" to evaluate the performance of machine learning algorithms for those applications that have uncertain input-output relationships caused due to human factors. * Demonstrated and analyzed the significance of this metric through experiments using several publicly available data sets. * Worked as a teaching assistant for computer networks course for 3 years
organization_description_6: * Designed routing protocols in Wireless Networks ranging from Wireless Sensor Networks to Vehicular Networks to Long-Term Evolution (LTE) for specific applications and simulated their performance using Network Simulator-2. * Developed and proposed a communication network architecture for Smart Grid Infrastructure. * Worked on converting proprietary Matlab codes to C codes for Low Density Parity Check (LDPC) application. This work involved splitting and distributing a file across several servers and then to regenerate the original file in spite of certain degree of server failures.

organization_description_7: * Designed a routing protocol for wireless sensor networks dubbed "Multi-service Adaptable Routing Protocol" that is power-aware, reliable and having low latency in delivering the information from source to destination. * Demonstated the performance through simulations using NS-2.

headline: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST
summary: “There is no hierarchy of control, it is the opportunity to learn, grow in responsibilities, to contribute and be recognized.”  I am a result-oriented professional with an illustrious career with prestigious ventures gaining cross-cultural exposure. With strong business insight and the ability to plan & execute strategies, I have abilities in analyzing large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns; specialized in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision (CV), and Deep Learning. headline: Senior Data Scientist at Walmart Global Tech
summary: Machine Learning and Data Science enthusiast. Skilled in Python, Matlab, C, C++,  Neural Network, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, etc.
organization_description_1: Market Intelligence
organization_title_2: Data Scientist | Supply Chain Analytics team
organization_description_2: Responsible for building and enhancing solutions to support Walmart’s supply chain operations. The solutions are used to plan the workforce, to smooth the flow of merchandise across the supply chain, and to ensure optimal availability at the stores.  1. Distribution Centers’ Flow Forecasting - Saved operational cost by 380mn USD annually     -- Built advanced forecasting models to predict the inbound and the outbound volume for Distribution Centers(DCs) for Short-range (1-28 days), Mid-range (29-91 days), and Long-range (1-52 weeks).    -- Forecasted across 45 Grocery DCs, 42 Regional DCs and 18 Sams Club DCs with an average accuracy of 90%.    -- Performed RCA for the DCs having higher error and devised approaches to improve their accuracy by 4.1%.    -- Improved the DC efficiency by devising a methodology to account the volumes that are being constrained.    -- Worked on various modeling techniques like Linear and Quantile Regression, XGBoost, Catboost, and Prophet.    -- Built a Plotly dashboard to track the KPIs for different Grocery, Regional, and Sams Club DCs.  2. Store Inbound Trailer Forecasting - Reduced lead-time and saved cost by 160mn USD annually      -- Built Prophet and Catboost models to forecast the trailers inbound to stores for labour planning for 1-91 days.     -- Scaled across 3817 stores with an average accuracy of 84% which is an improvement of 18% compared to the existing method.
organization_description_3: 1. Retail Shelf Analytics - Reduced Out-of-stock and in-store audit time by 4.1% and 43% respectively      -- Developed a Deep Learning (Object Detection) based framework to process and analyze retail shelf images.     -- Generated metrics for each SKU to identify the Count, Shelf Share, out-of-stock, placement, and promotion with an F1-score of 67.8%.  2. Ingredient Label Prediction From Product Recipe - A leading CPG client      -- Developed an ensemble of XgBoost, Random Forest, and Neural Network to predict the list of tentative ingredients which should be printed on the product label.     -- Scaled across 28 countries and more than 18k SKUs with an Fβ score of 0.836.   3. Sales Forecasting and Growth Driver Analysis - A leading CPG client      -- Analyzed the impact of different growth drivers, like media, promotions, holidays and pricing, on the sales using Bayesian Network.     -- Scaled across 18 brands and 13 states and achieved an average R-Squared of 0.82.
